meanings.definition: The act of occupying or taking possession of a place.
meanings.sent1: The occupancies of the chairs in the classroom were quickly filled by the students.
meanings.sent2: The hotel manager was responsible for monitoring the occupancies of the rooms.
meanings.sent3: During the game of musical chairs, the sudden occupancies of the seats caused laughter.
meanings.sent4: The occupancies of the parking spaces dwindled as the shopping mall became busier.
meanings.sent5: The occupancies of the tents at the campsite created a cozy atmosphere under the stars.

meanings.definition: The state of being occupied or filled.
meanings.sent1: The high occupancies of the restaurant indicated its popularity among diners.
meanings.sent2: The occupancies of the stadium seats increased as the game progressed.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected occupancies of the elevator made it feel cramped.
meanings.sent4: The occupancies of the shelves in the store made it challenging to find a specific item.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful park had low occupancies, allowing visitors to enjoy the tranquility.

meanings.definition: The number of units or spaces that are currently being used or rented out.
meanings.sent1: The hotel manager kept track of the occupancies to ensure all rooms were booked.
meanings.sent2: The high occupancies of the office building reflected a thriving business district.
meanings.sent3: The sudden occupancies of the rental bikes surprised the shop owner.
meanings.sent4: The occupancies of the apartments in the city center were in high demand.
meanings.sent5: The low occupancies of the parking lot indicated a slow day for the shopping center.
